oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Demolition of the Tulane Hotel on 8th and Church, Oct. 1956, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1956, Vol. 2 p.79
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the demolition of the Tulane Hotel at the corner of 8th Avenue North and Church Street, October of 1956. The site of the hotel was later rented for a parking lot operation to Roy J. Dennis and Monroe Carrel. Taken by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1956. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
